MyCovertChannel module

class MyCovertChannel.MyCovertChannel[source]

Bases: CovertChannelBase

  • You are not allowed to change the file name and class name.

  • You can edit the class in any way you want (e.g. adding helper functions); however, there must be a “send” and a “receive” function, the covert channel will be triggered by calling these functions.

receive(first_burst_num, second_burst_num, log_file_name, wait_time)[source]
Receives and decodes the message sent by the send function in packet bursts.
It counts the number of packets in a time interval and decides the bit value.

After each 8 bits it, decides the corresponding character. After receiving ‘.’ converts to corresponding string value and logs to file given by Receiver.log

Constraints: Parameters must be determined such that the difference between number of packet for 0 and 1 are at least 2. Moreover first_burst_num, second_burst_num, wait time must be the same for receive and send functions.

send(log_file_name, first_burst_num, second_burst_num, wait_time, ip)[source]

This function sends a random message generated by generate_random_binary_message_with_logging and encrypts it by using packet bursting method. Packets in bursts are ICMP packets, number of packets are determined in config.json file for 0 and 1 as optimum values. They are sent by using scapy’s send function.

Constraints: Parameters must be determined such that the difference between number of packet for 0 and 1 are at least 2. Moreover first_burst_num, second_burst_num, wait time must be the same for receive and send functions.

wait()[source]

Source Code

  1from CovertChannelBase import CovertChannelBase
  2from scapy.all import sniff,IP,ICMP,send
  3import time
  4
  5class MyCovertChannel(CovertChannelBase):
  6    """
  7    - You are not allowed to change the file name and class name.
  8    - You can edit the class in any way you want (e.g. adding helper functions); however, there must be a "send" and a "receive" function, the covert channel will be triggered by calling these functions.
  9    """
 10    def __init__(self):
 11        """
 12        - You can edit __init__.
 13        """
 14        super().__init__()
 15        self.message = ""
 16        self.flag = False
 17        self.packet_count = 0
 18        self.bits=[]
 19        self.b_num = 0
 20        self.start_flag = True
 21       
 22    
 23
 24    def wait(self):
 25        time.sleep(self.wait_time )
 26            
 27    def send(self, log_file_name, first_burst_num, second_burst_num,wait_time,ip):
 28        """
 29        This function sends a random message generated by generate_random_binary_message_with_logging and encrypts 
 30        it by using packet bursting method. Packets in bursts are ICMP packets, number of packets are determined
 31        in config.json file for 0 and 1 as optimum values. They are sent by using scapy's send function.
 32
 33        Constraints: Parameters must be determined such that the difference between number of packet for 0 and 1 
 34        are at least 2. Moreover first_burst_num, second_burst_num, wait time must be the same for receive and send functions.
 35        """
 36
 37        # 1 is 2 packets, 
 38        # 0 is 4 packets
 39        rec_IP = ip
 40        self.wait_time = wait_time
 41        starting_time = time.time()
 42
 43        # for 16 char message performance set to min_length=16 ,max_length=16
 44        binary_message = self.generate_random_binary_message_with_logging(log_file_name, min_length=50 ,max_length=100)
 45        for i in range(len(binary_message)):
 46            if binary_message[i] ==  '1':
 47                #send_two_packets change packet numbers give bigger to test the code, after you are sure you have no error proceed to smaller packet numbers
 48                for j in range(first_burst_num):
 49                    packet1 = IP(dst = rec_IP) / ICMP() 
 50                    super().send(packet1) 
 51                self.wait()
 52                
 53            else:
 54                #send_three_packets
 55                for j in range(second_burst_num):
 56                    packet1 = IP(dst = rec_IP) / ICMP() 
 57                    super().send(packet1) 
 58                self.wait()
 59
 60        last_packet = IP(dst = rec_IP) / ICMP()
 61        super().send(last_packet)
 62
 63        #code for performance test
 64        performance = 128/(time.time() - starting_time)
 65        print("Covert Channel Performance: ", performance)
 66
 67    def receive(self, first_burst_num, second_burst_num, log_file_name,wait_time):
 68        """
 69        Receives and decodes the message sent by the send function in packet bursts.
 70         It counts the number of packets in a time interval and decides the bit value.
 71          After each 8 bits it, decides the corresponding character. After receiving '.'
 72          converts to corresponding string value and logs to file given by Receiver.log
 73
 74        Constraints: Parameters must be determined such that the difference between number of packet for 0 and 1 
 75        are at least 2. Moreover first_burst_num, second_burst_num, wait time must be the same for receive and send functions.
 76        """
 77        
 78        self.wait_time = wait_time
 79        def receivePacket(packet):
 80
 81            if self.start_flag:
 82                self.start_time = time.time()
 83                self.start_flag = False
 84
 85            
 86
 87            in_time_interval = (time.time() - self.start_time ) > self.wait_time 
 88
 89            
 90            if packet and packet.haslayer(ICMP) and packet[ICMP].type == 8: 
 91                self.packet_count+=1
 92
 93            if(first_burst_num<second_burst_num):
 94                if in_time_interval:
 95                #print("packet count", self.packet_count)
 96                    if self.packet_count < (first_burst_num+1):
 97                        self.bits.append(1)
 98                        self.b_num+=1
 99                        self.packet_count = 0
100                        self.start_flag = True
101                    else:
102                        self.bits.append(0)
103                        self.b_num+=1
104                        self.packet_count = 0
105                        self.start_flag = True
106            else:
107                if in_time_interval:
108                    #print("packet count", self.packet_count)
109                    if self.packet_count < (second_burst_num+1):
110                        self.bits.append(1)
111                        self.b_num+=1
112                        self.packet_count = 0
113                        self.start_flag = True
114                    else:
115                        self.bits.append(0)
116                        self.b_num+=1
117                        self.packet_count = 0
118                        self.start_flag = True
119            
120            
121            
122
123            if self.b_num == 8:
124                #print("bits :", ''.join(map(str, self.bits)))
125                self.message += self.convert_eight_bits_to_character(''.join(map(str, self.bits)))
126                self.b_num = 0
127                self.bits = []
128                #print(self.message)
129
130                if self.message[-1] == '.': 
131                    #print("message", self.message) 
132                    self.log_message(message = self.message, log_file_name=log_file_name)
133                    self.flag = True 
134
135
136        
137    
138        def getFlag(packet):
139            return self.flag
140
141        
142
143        sniff(filter="icmp", prn = receivePacket, stop_filter = getFlag)  # should i put in init func???
144
145              
146
